item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:29, topic:551730”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=670646.msg4484642#msg4484642 date=1433167113]
And if you use an IDE, it will take care of import for you. It’s one of the many trivial tasks IDE is built for. There is no need for you to manually handle import unless there is a name conflict.
[/quote]

Oh O.K that’s really cool, how does it know what to import though? and so i just run my server through eclipse, IDE and it basically does everything for me?[/quote]
It does not do everything. There is a lot of interaction the user still needs to do
But for imports it’s really intelligent…
Like this:

All I’d have to do is click the first import, as that’s from the same package and I know it’s the correct one.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

tank nation: When you use something that is not imported, it will import it for you. If there is a name conflict it will make you pick which one is correct by looking at the package it’s in.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:26, topic:551730”]So for this first code ill have to take it and place it above in the Dropitem.java where the imports are? Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, itemId, c.getX(), c.getY(), c.playerItemsN[slot], c.getId());
so basically like this? import Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem;[/quote]

No, you don’t import individual methods. You import the entire class by using the package at the top as a guide. Again, if the class Woodcutting has this package at the top

Since the class is named Woodcutting, add that to the end.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:25, topic:551730”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670646.msg4484612#msg4484612 date=1433138642]
I just dont understand what im suppose to import im new kinda to the importing thing so thats where im mostly confused at, everything else iv’e gotten better with
[/quote]

To reiterate, an IDE would help a lot. However, usually at the top of a class there is it’s package.
Something like

That’s what you have to import, and imports go below the package declaration and above the public class.

For example, if you imported the class Woodcutting from the package from before, you would put it as such.

You can also do

to load every class in that package, but this isn’t commonly done as far as I know.

And to reiterate again, learn to use an IDE. It will remove all of the most basic problems from coding, and overall makes it easier to manage.[/quote]

So for this first code ill have to take it and place it above in the Dropitem.java where the imports are? Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, itemId, c.getX(), c.getY(), c.playerItemsN[slot], c.getId());
so basically like this? import Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem;

Read full topic

item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

tank nation:

I just dont understand what im suppose to import im new kinda to the importing thing so thats where im mostly confused at, everything else iv’e gotten better with

To reiterate, an IDE would help a lot. However, usually at the top of a class there is it’s package.
Something like

That’s what you have to import, and imports go below the package declaration and above the public class.

For example, if you imported the class Woodcutting from the package from before, you would put it as such.

You can also do

to load every class in that package, but this isn’t commonly done as far as I know.

And to reiterate again, learn to use an IDE. It will remove all of the most basic problems from coding, and overall makes it easier to manage.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

oracle:

To import a specific member into the current file, put an import statement at the beginning of the file before any type definitions but after the package statement, if there is one

item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:551730”]You need to create a ground item based on what the player just dropped…

	GroundItem(int id, int x, int y, int amount, int controller,
			int hideTicks, String name)[/code]
^Hint.

Also: Saving after every item dropped is a shit way to fix the drop item dupe. Learn to save when the socket is closed.[/quote]

This is error im getting now..     [code]boolean droppable = true;
		for (int i : Config.UNDROPPABLE_ITEMS) {
			if (i == itemId) {
				droppable = false;
				break;
			}
		}
	if (c.playerItemsN[slot] != 0 && itemId != -1
				&& c.playerItems[slot] == itemId + 1) {
			if (droppable) {
				if (c.underAttackBy > 0) {
					if (c.getShops().getItemShopValue(itemId) > 1000) {
						c.sendMessage("You may not drop items worth more than 1000 while in combat.");
						return;
					}
				}
								//c.sendMessage("Your item dissapears when it touches the ground."); // drop
																					// dissapearing
						Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, itemId, c.getX(), c.getY(), c.playerItemsN[slot], c.getId());
						c.getItems().deleteItem(itemId, slot, c.playerItemsN[slot]);
				ardi.model.players.PlayerSave.saveGame(c);
			} else {
				c.sendMessage("You can't drop this item.");
			}
		}	
	}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You need to create a ground item based on what the player just dropped…

GroundItem(int id, int x, int y, int amount, int controller, int hideTicks, String name)
^Hint.

Also: Saving after every item dropped is a shit way to fix the drop item dupe. Learn to save when the socket is closed.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropitem.java
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:7, topic:551730”]I typed it wrong,
the sequence is, according to your code,

[ol][li]c.getItems().deleteItem(itemId, slot, c.playerItemsN[slot]);[/li]
[li]ardi.model.players.PlayerSave.saveGame©;[/li][/ol]

if it’s droppable.

It doesn’t show anything related to dropping the item if the item is droppable nor anywhere else in the code.[/quote]

okay? so what i need to do so it drops on ground without disappearing. that’s what i’m asking

Read full topic
